        • pycheron.psd.McNamaraBins

    pycheron.psd.McNamaraBins¶

    McNamaraBins(f, spec, loFreq=0.005, hiFreq=10, alignFreq=0.1)[source]¶

    Calculate average values in bins using the McNamara algorithm [1].

    Frequencies for binning will be generated at 1/8 octave intervals aligned to alignFreq. Frequency smooth the averaged spectral values over 1-octave intervals at 1/8-octave increments, (reducing # frequency samples by factor of 169; include 10 Hz as one of the geometric mean f values to sync f sampling). In other words, binned values associated with each frequency bin are calculated by averaging incoming values over an entire octave centered on that frequency. The frequency smoothing (second to last step) involves averaging power values over an octave using a geometric mean and repeating at 1/8 octave intervals in frequency.

    Parameters:
    • f (numpy.ndarray) – Array of frequency values
    • spec (numpy.ndarray) – Array of spectral values generated by a PSD/CrossSpectrum function
    • loFreq (int) – Low end of frequency binning range
    • hiFreq (int) – High end of frequency binning range
    • alignFreq (int) – Alignment frequency for determining frequency bins
    Returns:

    Returns 2 arrays:

    • Binned frequency array (numpy.ndarray)
    • Binned Spectral array (numpy.ndarray)

    References

    [1]http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2005/1438/pdf/OFR-1438.pdf
